post.description: This is used to upload IP data. Not needed if you are implementing /orders/upload (instead pass IP data there) - only used if you are on a supported integration and want to board with compelling evidence.

get.description: Get a specific the order from your chargeblast account. Receipt info is included with this endpoint.

post.description: Enroll the merchant in a various alert program. If no merchant_id is specified a new merchant object will be automatically generated. For each alert program various info is required. For example, for Ethoca, only descriptors are. To see which info is required see [here](https://docs.chargeblast.io/reference/enrollment-criteria)

get.description: Get all the merchants from your chargeblast account.
Get all the alerts from your chargeblast account.
Get an individual merchant from your chargeblast account.

post.description: Update the state of an alert to properly inform the banks of whether or not a refund will be issued. If an alert is left unactioned for 72 hours it will be automatically declined. For best results mark alerts as resolved within 24 hours of receiving them (some smaller banks will escalate quarantined transactions as soon as 24 hours within propogating an alert). If you attempt to update an already actioned alert, the request will fail.

get.description: Get all the alerts from your chargeblast account.

post.description: Pass in a given descriptor_id to unenroll merchant's descriptor. Ethoca alerts take 48 hours to confirm unenrollment, RDR ~2 weeks, CDRN ~24 hours.
Creates a credit request for a rejected alert. Will fail if requesting credit from resolved alert or alert with an existing credit request, otherwise will simply return 200 response code.

Update the state of an alert to properly inform the banks of whether or not a refund will be issued. If an alert is left unactioned for 72 hours it will be automatically declined. For best results mark alerts as resolved within 24 hours of receiving them (some smaller banks will escalate quarantined transactions as soon as 24 hours within propogating an alert). If you attempt to update an already actioned alert, the request will fail.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The starting page of the request. Default value of 0.
How many objects to request per page. Default value of 10.
parameters.name: per

get.description: Get all the orders from your chargeblast account. Receipt info is omitted from this endpoint.

post.description: Upload orders to the chargeblast system. This will allow you to match disputes and chargebacks to the orders you have uploaded. Amount should be in cents, e.g. $19.99 => amount = 1999. This endpoint is rate limited to 100 requests every 10 seconds.

get.description: Fetch all the descriptors for your merchants.
Get all the alerts from your chargeblast account.

parameters.description: The starting page of the request. Default value of 0.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: How many objects to request per page. Default value of 10.
parameters.name: per

productDescription.description: A more detailed description of the product.

currency.description: 3 character ISO currency code. If nil, defaults to USD.

quantity.description: The quantity of the line item (defaults to 1).

price.description: The total price (in cents) of the line item. For if you bought 5 socks at $2 each, this field would be 1000.

ip.description: The ip address of the customer.

authCode.description: The authorization code of the charge. Used for matching purposes.

amount.description: The amount, in cents, of the order. For example, $19.99 would be 1999.

descriptor.description: The billing descriptor of the charge.

id.description: The internal id of the order in your CRM.

transactionDate.description: The date of the charge either in yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ format or yyyy-MM-dd format.

brand.description: The brand of the card (case insensitive). visa, mastercard, amex, discover. Other values will default to unknown

gateway.description: If multiple gateways are used, the gateway of the transaction. Used for analytics only.

arn.description: The acquirer reference number of the charge, if available.

status.description: The status of the transaction. Should be either 'succeeded' or 'failed'

refunded.description: Whether the transaction has already been refunded.

receipt.description: Additional info on the transaction. Only required for digital receipts and compelling evidence (pre-dispute re-presentment).

phoneForReceipt.description: The phone number to appear on the digital receipt, for the merchant's contact.

emailForReceipt.description: The email address to appear on the digital receipt, for the merchant's contact.

websiteForReceipt.description: The website URL to appear on the digital receipt, for the merchant's contact.

receiptAddress.description: The address to appear on the digital receipt, for the merchant's contact.

merchantReceiptContact.description: Your business contact information. Mandatory field if you are passing in merchant level details for each order.

name.description: The name of the merchant to appear on the digital receipt, e.g. 'Netflix'

description.description: A brief description of the business, e.g. 'Media Streaming Business'

refundPolicyLink.description: A url linking to a refund policy. Include https://, e.g. 'https://netflix.com/refund-policy'

cancellationPolicyLink.description: A url linking to a cancel policy. Include https://, e.g. 'https://netflix.com/cancel-policy'

termsAndConditionsLink.description: A url linking to a terms of service. Include https://, e.g. 'https://netflix.com/terms-of-service'

logoUrl.description: A url linking to a logo of the business. For best results use square pngs (ideally 256x256, though other resolutions are supported).

explanation.description: If the transaction is not eligible for compelling evidence, an explanation is provided.

merchantInfo.description: Override default merchant info. We recommend leaving this blank unless you are a merchant of record platform.

customerPhone.description: Phone number if applicable, e.g. +14016993099. String in any ISO format is acceptable.

shippingAddress.description: If a physical product, the shipping address of the customer.

billingAddress.description: The billing address of the customer.

name.description: The billing address of the customer.

countrySubdivision.description: For US addresses, the state - two letter coded. E.g. CA

country.description: The country spelled out, e.g. 'United States of America' or abbreviated 'USA'.

provider.description: Provider associated with the alert. Possible values: ethoca, verifi

issuer.description: Issuer of the card (e.g., bank or financial institution).

invoicedAt.description: Date and time when the alert was invoiced.

authCode.description: Authorization code for the transaction, if available.

site.description: Merchant's website or site string associated with the alert.

customerEmail.description: Customer's email address associated with the alert, if available.

creditStatus.description: Status of the credit (if any) associated with the alert.

alertType.description: Type of alert, e.g., FRAUD, DISPUTE.

creditAppealed.description: Indicates if the credit associated with the alert was appealed.

currency.description: Currency code in ISO format (e.g., USD, EUR) for the transaction.

reasonCode.description: Reason code associated with the alert, often indicating the nature of the dispute.

createdAt.description: Date and time when the alert was created.

merchantId.description: Identifier for the merchant within the system.

acquirerAction.description: Actions taken by the acquirer in response to the alert. Only relevant for RDR and other acquirer side alerts - either Resolved or Declined.

alertId.description: Unique identifier for the alert within the provider's system. Will match the id field.

amount.description: Transaction amount for the alert. $139.38 will be represented as 139.38

resolvedDate.description: Date and time when the alert was resolved.

resolvedByApi.description: Indicates if the alert was resolved via API.

externalOrder.description: External charge id related to the alert.

externalUrl.description: URL linking to an external reference for the alert.

creditNotes.description: Additional notes or information regarding the credit status.

arn.description: Acquirer Reference Number, unique identifier for the transaction.

transactionDate.description: Date and time when the transaction took place.

customerId.description: Unique identifier for the customer associated with the alert, if available.

descriptor.description: Billing descriptor shown on the card statement.

subprovider.description: Specific sub-provider within the provider service.

cardBrand.description: The card network (e.g., Visa, Mastercard, Amex).

responseAction.description: Response action taken in response to the alert.
